intro: Araucaria cunninghamii subsp. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Araucaria, is a coniferous tree native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Araucariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, pyramidal crown. The tree produces distinctive seed cones that are typically 10–20 cm long, containing edible seeds surrounded by a fibrous outer layer. Its leaves are needle-like and become more pronounced with age, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This subspecies is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat.
